definition: maiden stage role/first performance/first public showing
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: Many great people will be gracing the opening night of the play.
sentences.chinese: 许多重要人物的光临将为此剧的首演增色不少。

sentences.english: The performance will include the premiere of three new ballets.
sentences.chinese: 三段新编芭蕾舞将在演出中首演。

sentences.english: Dedicated to all music lovers who have contributed to the success of this première.
sentences.chinese: 献给为本次成功首演而贡献力量的各位音乐爱好者们。

sentences.english: It is slated to premiere during City Opera's 2013 spring season.
sentences.chinese: 预计改编后的歌剧版将于2013年春季举行首演。

sentences.english: A new one, “Two Belles in Love,” opened in Beijing in May.
sentences.chinese: 新排昆剧《怜香伴》，五月份在北京首演。

sentences.english: A symphony concert will debut in the Water Cube during the National Day holiday.
sentences.chinese: 例句十一时期，水立方将举行交响音乐会的首演。

sentences.english: Love Never Dies premiered at the Adelphi in London Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 真爱不死》在伦敦爱德菲剧院全球首演。

sentences.english: It opened in 1962 and ran 964 performances.
sentences.chinese: 这部剧在1962年首演，一共演出了964场。

sentences.english: A new one, “Two Belles in Love, ” opened in Beijing in May.
sentences.chinese: 新排昆剧《怜香伴》，五月份在北京首演。

sentences.english: It. s one of the premiere technology think tanks in the world.
sentences.chinese: 它是技术之一的首演中智库世界。

definition: to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
(theater etc) to tour/to be on tour/to give itinerant performances/abbr. for 巡迴演出|巡回演出[xun2 hui2 yan3 chu1]
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
